intro: Psychotria tinifolia, commonly known as the "Cape Verde Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria tinifolia is often found in coastal areas and has adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest for botanists studying plant adaptation.
